page.title: 01Sandy Railway Station
page.content:
The present station at Sandy provides an interesting contrast. On the 'town' or western side is one of the original nineteenth century platforms with recently cleaned buildings, constructed of yellow brick made of local Gault clay. These face a simple modern platform with a bus shelter type building to protect passengers from wind and rain.
The station is relatively important, especially for commuter traffic to Hitchin, Stevenage and London. Its history is, however, much more complex and interesting than its simple layout would suggest.
